Fundamental Duty 2: Cherish Freedom Struggle Ideals

Article 51A(b) - Keeping alive the spirit of India's independence movement

üß© Comprehensive Understanding

Article 51A(b) requires citizens to cherish and follow the noble ideals that inspired India's freedom struggle:

  • Values of non-violence (Ahimsa) and civil disobedience
  • Principles of national unity and communal harmony
  • Spirit of sacrifice demonstrated by freedom fighters
  • Democratic and inclusive vision of the independence movement
  • Commitment to social justice and equality

This duty connects modern India with its historical struggle for independence, ensuring continuity of national values.

üìñ Detailed Explanation

The duty serves multiple constitutional purposes:

  • Educational Role:
    • Mandates teaching freedom struggle history in schools
    • Inspires civic responsibility through historical examples
  • National Integration:
    • Highlights shared struggle against colonialism
    • Transcends regional/religious differences
  • Legal Impact:
    • Guides interpretation of sedition laws
    • Informs reasonable restrictions on free speech

The duty is operationalized through commemorative events, museums, and educational programs nationwide.

üìú Historical Context

This duty was shaped by:

  • 42nd Amendment (1976) during Emergency
    • Added on Swaran Singh Committee's recommendation
    • Coincided with 25th anniversary of independence
  • Freedom Movement Legacy
    • Gandhian philosophy of Satyagraha
    • Revolutionary sacrifices of Bhagat Singh, Bose
    • Constitutional vision of Nehru, Ambedkar
  • Post-Independence Challenges
    • Need for national unity after Partition
    • Preserving pluralistic freedom struggle narrative

The duty reflects the Constituent Assembly's desire to institutionalize freedom movement values.

üèõÔ∏è Judicial Interpretations

  • S. Rangarajan v. P. Jagjivan Ram (1989) : Upheld freedom of expression while recognizing duty to respect national struggle. [AIR 1989 SC 876]
  • Bijoe Emmanuel v. State of Kerala (1986) : Balanced fundamental rights with duties to national ideals. [AIR 1987 SC 748]
  • Arup Bhuyan v. State of Assam (2011) : Cited freedom struggle ideals while interpreting anti-terror laws. [2011 (3) SCC 377]

üîç Contemporary Practice

  • Celebration of "Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav" (75 years of independence)
  • Digital archives of freedom fighters' contributions
  • Debates about accurate historical representation
  • Use of freedom struggle imagery in political discourse
  • School programs like "Pariksha Pe Charcha" invoking freedom struggle values
); }
